misconfigurations.scenario: user wants fault tolerant internet access
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: instances exist in more azs than nat gateways exist
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: create nat gateway in each az where an ec2 instance exists

misconfigurations.scenario: High data transfer costs from cross-region or internet data egress without optimization
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: Significant data transfer charges from cross-region transfers, CloudFront not used for content delivery, or compute/storage in different regions
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Use CloudFront for content delivery (free S3-to-CloudFront transfer), co-locate resources in same region, use VPC endpoints, and PrivateLink for AWS service access
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: Data transfer costs can represent 10-20% of AWS bills when not optimized. Key strategies: 1) Use CloudFront for content delivery (data transfer from S3 to CloudFront is free), 2) Keep compute and storage in same region/AZ, 3) Use VPC endpoints for S3/DynamoDB to avoid internet gateway charges, 4) Leverage AWS PrivateLink for service-to-service communication, 5) Use S3 Transfer Acceleration selectively. Cross-region transfers cost $0.02/GB while same-region is free.
misconfigurations.notes: AWS Well-Architected Framework - Data transfer optimization

metadata.source: AWS Well-Architected Framework Cost Optimization Pillar 2025
